siteProductLine.name: Sport Trail
siteProductLine.overview:
The Carlstar/Carlisle Sport Trail is a trailer tire specially designed for drivers looking for durability and stability. Ideal for utility trailers, horse and stock trailers, boat trailers, cargo trailers and most specialty trailers, the Carlstar/Carlisle Sport Trail will take you where you need to go without any interruptions. The wraparound tread delivers precise cornering allowing you to steer at even the most challenging roads while maintaining safety. It was specially made to be durable which means was designed to be resistant against harsh conditions. Its bias construction rather than radial, makes it the perfect tire to use for long-term use. Extending its treadlife are the rugged sidewalls which are resistant to puncture and bruise. Providing you traction during rainy water are the optimally designed treads which drains water efficiently to prevent slippage. To add appeal to your trailer is the black sidewall give the Carlstar/Carlisle Sport Trail a classic look. This tire is bias belted which means it can be driven at highway speeds.

Features & Benefits
  • A popular option for many kinds of trailers
  • Long-lasting and durable construction perfect for long-term use
  • Efficient water evacuation to reduce slippage on wet road surfaces
  • Carlisle branded tires are now Carlstar, and offer the same excellent performance, durability, and value that they have for the past 100 years

siteProductSpecs.name: Vehicle
siteProductSpecs.description: These tires are intended for trailer axles only, and can withstand long miles of in-line hauling. They're not meant for steering or drive axle applications, and their design offers years of reliable service in trailer applications. Choose from favorites like Gladiator, Carlisle and Goodyear trailer tires.

siteProductSpecs.name: Mileage Warranty
siteProductSpecs.description: This product is not covered by a manufacturer’s treadlife warranty.

siteProductSpecs.name: Load Range
siteProductSpecs.description: The maximum load carrying strength at the specified inflation pressure, also known as ply rating.

siteProductSpecs.name: Sidewall
siteProductSpecs.description: The side of the tire between the tread and rim, with cosmetic branding as well as information about the tire including manufacturer, model, size, etc.

siteProductSpecs.name: Part Number
siteProductSpecs.description: An identifier of a particular tire line and size combination assigned by the tire manufacturer.

siteProductSpecs.name: Tread Design
siteProductSpecs.description: Tread design (or tread pattern) can affect handling, traction & noise for different driving styles & road conditions.

siteProductSpecs.name: Overall Diameter
siteProductSpecs.description: The diameter of a tire that is inflated without any load applied.
